verses.verse: And (Lev. 8:8; Num. 27:21; Deut. 33:8; 1 Sam. 28:6; Ezra 2:63; Neh. 7:65) you shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be over Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the LORD. So Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel over his heart before the LORD continually.
(Other Priestly Garments) (Ex. 39:22-26) “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
There shall be an opening for his head in the middle of it; it shall have a woven binding all around its opening, like the opening in a coat of mail, so that it does not tear.
And upon its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet, all around its hem, and bells of gold between them all around:
a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe all around.
And it shall be upon Aaron when he ministers, and its sound will be heard when he goes into the holy place before the LORD and when he comes out, that he may not die.
(Ex. 39:30, 31; Lev. 8:9; Zech. 14:20) “You shall also make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engraving of a signet: HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
And you shall put it on a blue cord, that it may be on the turban; it shall be on the front of the turban.

So it shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may (Ex. 28:43; Lev. 10:17; 22:9, 16; Num. 18:1; (Is. 53:11); Ezek. 4:4-6; (John 1:29; Heb. 9:28; 1 Pet. 2:24)) bear the iniquity of the holy things which the children of Israel hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall always be on his forehead, that they may be (Lev. 1:4; 22:27; 23:11; Is. 56:7) accepted before the LORD.
“You shall (Ex. 35:35; 39:27-29) skillfully weave the tunic of fine linen thread, you shall make the turban of fine linen, and you shall make the sash of woven work.
(Ex. 28:4; 39:27-29, 41; Ezek. 44:17, 18) “For Aaron’s sons you shall make tunics, and you shall make sashes for them. And you shall make hats for them, for glory and (Ex. 28:2) beauty.

So you shall put them on Aaron your brother and on his sons with him. You shall (Ex. 29:7-9; 30:30; 40:15; Lev. 10:7) anoint them, (Ex. 29:9; Lev. 8; Heb. 7:28) consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister to Me as priests.
And you shall make (Ex. 39:28; Lev. 6:10; 16:4; Ezek. 44:18) for them linen trousers to cover their nakedness; they shall reach from the waist to the thighs.

They shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they come into the tabernacle of meeting, or when they come near (Ex. 20:26) the altar to minister in the holy place, that they (Lev. 5:1, 17; 20:19, 20; 22:9; Num. 9:13; 18:22) do not incur iniquity and die. (Ex. 27:21; Lev. 17:7) It shall be a statute forever to him and his descendants after him.
(Aaron and His Sons Consecrated) “And this is what you shall do to them to hallow them for ministering to Me as priests: (Lev. 8; (Heb. 7:26-28)) Take one young bull and two rams without blemish,
and (Lev. 2:4; 6:19-23) unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil (you shall make them of wheat flour).
You shall put them in one basket and bring them in the basket, with the bull and the two rams.
“And Aaron and his sons you shall bring to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, (Ex. 40:12; Lev. 8:6; (Heb. 10:22)) and you shall wash them with water.

(Ex. 28:2; Lev. 8:7) Then you shall take the garments, put the tunic on Aaron, and the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the (Ex. 28:8) intricately woven band of the ephod.
(Ex. 28:36, 37; Lev. 8:9) You shall put the turban on his head, and put the holy crown on the turban.
And you shall take the anointing (Ex. 25:6; 30:25-31; Lev. 8:12; 10:7; 21:10; Num. 35:25; Ps. 133:2) oil, pour it on his head, and anoint him.
Then (Ex. 28:39, 40; Lev. 8:13) you shall bring his sons and put tunics on them.

And you shall gird them with sashes, Aaron and his sons, and put the hats on them. (Ex. 40:15; Num. 3:10; 18:7; 25:13; Deut. 18:5) The priesthood shall be theirs for a perpetual statute. So you shall (Ex. 28:41; Lev. 8) consecrate Aaron and his sons.
“You shall also have the bull brought before the tabernacle of meeting, and (Lev. 1:4; 8:14) Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the bull.
Then you shall kill the bull before the LORD, by the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
You shall take some of the blood of the bull and put it on (Lev. 8:15) the horns of the altar with your finger, and (Ex. 27:2; 30:2; Lev. 4:7) pour all the blood beside the base of the altar.
And (Lev. 1:8; 3:3, 4) you shall take all the fat that covers the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.
But (Lev. 4:11, 12, 21; Heb. 13:11) the flesh of the bull, with its skin and its offal, you shall burn with fire outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
(Lev. 8:18) “You shall also take one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall (Lev. 1:4-9) put their hands on the head of the ram;
and you shall kill the ram, and you shall take its blood and (Ex. 24:6; Lev. 1:5, 11) sprinkle it all around on the altar.
Then you shall cut the ram in pieces, wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces and with its head.
And you shall burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a (Ex. 20:24) burnt offering to the LORD; it is a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
(Lev. 8:22) “You shall also take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the ram.

Then you shall kill the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, on the thumb of their right hand and on the big toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood all around on the altar.

And you shall take some of the blood that is on the altar, and some of (Ex. 30:25, 31; Lev. 8:30) the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and on his garments, on his sons and on the garments of his sons with him; and (Ex. 28:41; 29:1; (Heb. 9:22)) he and his garments shall be hallowed, and his sons and his sons’ garments with him.

“Also you shall take the fat of the ram, the fat tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, the two kidneys and the fat on them, the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration),
(Lev. 8:26) one loaf of bread, one cake made with oil, and one wafer from the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the LORD;
and you shall put all these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and you shall (Lev. 7:30; 10:14) wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
(Lev. 8:28) You shall receive them back from their hands and burn them on the altar as a burnt offering, as a sweet aroma before the LORD. It is an offering made by fire to the LORD.
“Then you shall take (Lev. 7:31, 34; 8:29) the breast of the ram of Aaron’s consecration and wave it as a wave offering before the LORD; and it shall be your portion.

And from the ram of the consecration you shall consecrate (Lev. 7:31, 34; Num. 18:11, 18; Deut. 18:3) the breast of the wave offering which is waved, and the thigh of the heave offering which is raised, of that which is for Aaron and of that which is for his sons.

It shall be from the children of Israel for Aaron and his sons (Lev. 10:15) by a statute forever. For it is a heave offering; (Lev. 3:1; 7:34) it shall be a heave offering from the children of Israel from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, that is, their heave offering to the LORD.
“And the (Ex. 28:2) holy garments of Aaron (Num. 20:26, 28) shall be his sons’ after him, (Ex. 28:41; 30:30; Num. 18:8) to be anointed in them and to be consecrated in them.
(Num. 20:28) That son who becomes priest in his place shall put them on for (Lev. 8:35) seven days, when he enters the tabernacle of meeting to minister in the holy place.
“And you shall take the ram of the consecration and (Lev. 8:31) boil its flesh in the holy place.
Then Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the (Matt. 12:4) bread that is in the basket, by the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
